author: Rajiv Tangri
title: Fund the masses
description: How do we get DeFi to take off on ADA as the current barrier to entry on Ethereum is very high

assessments.note: A defi lending plattform can help to scale-up carano's DEFI ecosystem. The community would benefit as there are more people using cardano.

The proposal does not clearly communicate the goal of the challenge. The entry to DeFi on Ethereum is primarily due to the high fees. People with high student loans are more likely to be able to enter DeFi than the unbanked - which is one important aspect of the challenge.
The concept is a little short on details.

this proposal doesn't have a clear problem that it addresses, nor a clear plan on how loans and staking will bring additional users into Cardano's DeFi space. it would be helpful to know what the loan structure and staking structure is for a more complete evaluation. The proposal also plans on using a central server.

There is no description of a problem in the problem statement. The creation of a dapp that allows loans is within the scope of the challenge, but the goals are not reasonable and do not indicate how the proposal will address the challenge in the next 6 months.
Nice germ of an idea for a defi project. No real detailed plan on how to implement or achieve the goals.
The plan doesn't explain how real-life assets or credit rating can enter in the smart contract.

A physician that works in cancer imaging and therapy has probably a lot of work to do. This sounds like a full time job. I'm not quite sure why it is important that the proposer has a mortage, education loans and staked ada. 

There are already other lending proposals that already started biulding. It is gonna be difficult to catch up if you have to search and hire devs first.

30k for marketing is in my opinion not necessairy as good projects in crypto don't need marketing and our community has a lot of proposals regarding marketing.

Having a want to solve the challenge for oneself does not automatically mean one is capable of implementing a vague idea successfully. The proposal does not indicate a good understanding of the developer market, infrastructure cost, nor does it communicate if relationships to lenders exist.
The proposer doesn't have any technical experience in the field.

Given the plan and the proposer's skill set there is a large risk that the proposal will not be able to deliver a working product. The budget for a programmer is extremely low, and the skill's that the hired programmer should have isn't identified which adds to the risk that the hired person may not be the right person for the job.

There is no reasonable plan, the creation of a loan protocol requires details about the financial and technical model so that it is possible to assess the viability. The experience described by the proposer is not related to the requirements for the execution of the proposal.

The information and requirements for the team are insufficient, the development of a dapp of this type requires developers with skills in several different areas, such as the development of smart contracts, front ent, financial model, web devlopment, among others and there is no mention of which will be technical requirements for the team. What is the purpose of a $ 30,000 marketing budget when there is no development plan yet? The budget is unreasonable and does not reflect the costs required to pay the staff required for this kind of project for one year.

No detailed plan on how to actually implement. How are you managing the loans. Interest rates? collateral levels? Essentially this is just taking a leveraged position in ADA. To secure the loans this would have to be marked to market. Given ADA traded in a range of .92 - 1.55 just last month this could be a very risky porposition.

The past experience is irrelevant for this project.
The plan is imprecise, and doesn't explain the economy of the project.
There is a plan on what the proposal would like to achieve. Unfortunately there is not that much information on how they would achieve it. A more detailed roadmap and a risk assessment would be good.
The proposal appears to be roughly oversimplified while providing numbers that seem unrealistic.
There is a general outline of the idea. But the proposal originates in a personal experience, and not in an understanding of the DeFi market, or need for the product.
while the proposal identifies some basic goals, the proposal fails to show that they are directly related to the problem statement.

It is necessary to refine the proposal in general, to include technical details and the financial model of the protocol. The development of a loan dapp requires a staff with different skills and this is not specified in the proposal. The budget breakdown is not reasonable, the costs have been underestimated. The established goals are questionable, as they are extremely subjective and do not help to indicate success in the challenge. There is no roadmap, no milestones, no KPIs.

I recommend including this information and, if necessary, the proposer can ask for help to assemble it.
Please provide both technical implementation plans and operational/risk management plans.
The project description is about resources ; not what needs to be done or how to achieve the goal.

solution:
1\. Staked funds can be loaned and borrowed against in ADA.

Many of us want to stake ADA, but we want to pay off our loans. Lets do both.
experience:
I am a physician that works in cancer imaging and therapy, so I have a lot of loans in education and I have a mortgage.  
I have staked ADA.
